component.name: Unvanquished
component.summary: Fast paced, first person strategy game

description.p:
Unvanquished is a real-time strategy game played as a first-person shooter where evolving aliens and heavily armed humans fight for their survival.
Become a marine, handle your big weapon and dress that impressive exoskeleton to save the human race like a boss. Or if you prefer, be a monstrous beast and save those cute grangers from those two-legged invaders who only know how to turn beautiful organic equilibrium into lifeless machines and dead concreted worlds.

description.p: This update improves the fogging, makes possible to bind the mouse wheel in the menus, fixes toggled rotating doors, enable Wayland and upgrades to SDL3.
This update fixes a bug disconnecting people from servers when some maps were loaded, improve some visuals and brings better shader compilation times.
This update brings the vampire mode, new command and vsay menus, along other improvements and bugfixes.
This update makes bots able to use the jetpack and brings a bunch of bugfixes. It is now possible to use the curses console interface.
This update brings better bots, improvements for the user interface, and bugfixes for maps and the rendering of specific textures and fog.
This update brings translations, and many engine improvements: new features, bugfixes, compatibility with the large amount of community maps and performance improvement.

This update brings automatic server-side navigation mesh generation and many fixes and improvements.
This update fixes rendering issues with legacy Tremulous maps, restores the granger slow blob, and the regression preventing to type Unicode characters in chat is now gone!
This update fixes the unexpected disconnection bug, restores modified gravity in maps and makes some text more readable.
This large update comes with HUD improvements, better bots, updated Parpax map and many bug fixes.
This update brings some bug fixes and marks the first point release in Unvanquished 0.52 beta development cycle.
The first beta release, coming after years of continuous work both on the engine and the game itself.
